questions.text: Where is the vault located in this level?
questions.correct: The first locked room you enter
options: The second locked room you enter
The crypt where you free ghosts
questions.explanation:
The first locked room you enter.

	Like all other vaults, don't worry if you don't have all the bottles to open it, as this door will remain unlocked so you can come back whenever you like.  The door is on the roof opposite the re-education tower.

questions.text: How many candles are on the title screen?
questions.explanation:
Seven.

	You can see the Contessa on the title screen on a web, with candles surrounding her.  The Contessa is an undercover agent, who betrays several people.  She claims to be a cop at Interpol, but she really is a member of the Klaww Gang.

questions.text: What color is the moon in this level?
questions.explanation:
Orange.

	The moon glows orange in this spooky level.  Vampiric bats, werewolves, and ghosts are everywhere in this level, because the moon is full.  Some werewolves are even trapped in statues, and they jump out at you along the way.

questions.text: What is the tower where the Clockwerk parts are located called?
questions.explanation:
Re-education Tower.

	The re-education tower is where Carmelita is locked up.  The Contessa is in there for most of the level, along with three of her shadow guards.  In this level you must free  Carmelita and drive the shadow guards and the Contessa out of the room so you can steal the Clockwerk eyes.

questions.text: What are the Clockwerk parts held by the Contessa used for?
options: To erase the mind of Carmelita
To steal the brain of Carmelita
questions.explanation:
To hypnotize Carmelita.

	The Contessa uses the Clockwerk eyes along with a machine to hypnotize Carmelita.  Carmelita is strong, however, and resists.  The machine used is a machine Bentley didn't think existed.  It is made of half science and half black magic.

questions.text: What is the name of the general you must capture?
questions.explanation:
Clawfoot.

	General Clawfoot is an old bat that cannot be hurt.  In fact, Bentley tells Murray he couldn't be hurt if you TRIED to hurt him.  The only things he is afraid of is water and fire.  Murray must capture him and take him to the safehouse.  He is the one to do it because he can pick up enemies.  You must first stun him by whacking him, then you hit the ground with your foot. This causes him to fly in the air so you can catch him.  The benefit of carrying him is that he is unlike most enemies, so it will not kill him if you throw him.  He is a great projectile to kill other enemies, and it will not hurt him.

questions.text: What creature is the bad mojo statues?
questions.explanation:
Bat.

	The bad mojo statues are all bats.  The bad mojo comes out of the mouth of the bad and is magnetized onto Bentley's mojo collector.  Bad mojo is red.

questions.text: What animal does Carmelita call the Contessa?
questions.explanation:
Cow.

	The Contessa is trying to talk Carmelita into not resisting the hypnosis.  She claims that when she has been hypnotized, they will become good friends.  Carmelita replies by saying, "Noooo, you horrible eight-legged cow!  No!"

questions.text: Who starts the final operation in this level?
questions.explanation:
Murray.

	Murray must start this operation, although he doesn't do much.  Once you get to the point to begin, a video takes place and he automatically bursts through the door and does the job so you don't have to.  You then get to play Sly and paraglide to the blimp.  The title of this operation is "High Road".

Irontech 2-50.

	The first time this torture device is mentioned, you do not see how it is spelled.  However, the second time it is mentioned, you see it is spelled like 2-50, not 250.  Bentley is amazed by the ancient device.
